initial_story:
Police have deployed an armoured vehicle to pry open the cabin of a lorry on a motorway in Texas.

The driver refused to stop, or get out of the cab when officers used spike strips to stop the vehicle, police said.

After the armoured vehicle tore open a window, police threw in a gas canister, before going inside and pulling the driver out.

It is unclear what started the chase, but police said the driver used "evasive manoeuvres", changing lanes multiple times and swerving.

“We still don’t know why he was acting in the erratic manner that he was,” Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told journalists, adding that he appeared to have "some heavy impairment".
stories:
Police have sent an armored car to break into the cabin of a semi-truck on a Texas highway.

The driver refused to stop or leave the cab after officers tried to stop him with tire-deflating devices, authorities stated.

After an armored vehicle shattered a window, police deployed a tear gas canister inside the cabin and then took the driver out.

It's unclear what provoked the high-speed pursuit, but police claimed the driver used aggressive techniques, frequently switching lanes and steering the vehicle erratically.

"We're still uncertain why he was behaving in a reckless manner," Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told reporters, mentioning that the driver seemed to be heavily impaired.

An armoured vehicle was dispatched to forcibly enter a tractor-trailer cabin on a Texas highway after its driver refused to halt or exit the cab despite attempted tire deflation, authorities reported. After piercing a window with an armoured vehicle, police deployed tear gas and manually removed the driver from the cab. The cause of the high-speed pursuit remains uncertain, but authorities alleged the driver employed aggressive driving techniques, rapidly shifting lanes and operating the vehicle erratically. Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez noted to journalists that the driver's erratic behaviour seemed to be caused by significant impairment.

Law enforcement dispatched an armored vehicle to forcefully enter a tractor-trailer's cabin on a Texas highway after the driver refused to stop or exit despite efforts to deflate the tires. After breaching a window with the armored vehicle, police used tear gas and forcibly removed the driver from the cab. The reasons behind the high-speed pursuit are still unknown, but authorities claim the driver was aggressive in their driving, weaving in and out of lanes and handling the vehicle recklessly. Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told reporters that the driver's erratic behavior was likely caused by significant intoxication.

Police responded by dispatching an armoured vehicle to forcefully gain entry to a tractor-trailer on a Texas highway after its driver refused to stop or exit, despite efforts to deflate the tyres. Following breach of a cabin window using the armoured vehicle, officers deployed tear gas to remove the driver, who had been displaying aggressive driving and reckless handling. While the reasons behind the pursuit remain unclear, authorities note that the driver's erratic actions suggest significant alcohol intoxication, as stated by Sheriff Ed Gonzalez of Harris County.

Law enforcement sent an armored vehicle to forcefully enter a semi-truck on a Texas highway after the driver refused to stop or exit, despite repeated attempts to puncture the tires. Following the armed vehicle's breach of a cabin window, officers used tear gas to remove the driver, who had been exhibiting aggressive driving and reckless behavior. The reasons for the pursuit remain unclear, but authorities suspect that the driver's erratic actions were likely a result of significant alcohol impairment, according to Sheriff Ed Gonzalez of Harris County.

Following the breach of a cabin window by the armed vehicle, officers employed tear gas to remove the driver, who had been engaging in erratic and reckless driving. While the motivations behind the pursuit are unclear, investigators believe that the driver's erratic behavior was likely caused by significant drunkenness.

The investigation into the cause of the pursuit is ongoing, but it appears that the driver's erratic behavior was largely caused by drunkenness.
